page.title: All your base are belong to us

Line 30: Line 30:
*In the [[March 12]] [[2001]] edition of ''[[FoxTrot]]'', Jason Fox (the [[nerd]]y youngest child) began to shout, "All your base are belong to us!" confusing his parents. [[Bill Amend]] has been known to incorporate "geek culture" into his comic strips, such as the [[MMORPG]] ''World of <!-- READ THIS: Please DO NOT CHANGE THIS to âWarcraftâââWarquestâ is a fictional game from the comic strip, obviously a joke mixing Warcraft and Everquest. Thanks for your cooperation. -->Warquest.''<ref>{{cite web | author=Amend, Bill|date=[[2001-03-12]] | url=http://homepage.mac.com/brossow/wikipedia/foxtrot_aybabtu.gif | title=FoxTrot | format=GIF | accessdate=2006-05-15}}</ref>
*In the [[March 12]] [[2001]] edition of ''[[FoxTrot]]'', Jason Fox (the [[nerd]]y youngest child) began to shout, "All your base are belong to us!" confusing his parents. [[Bill Amend]] has been known to incorporate "geek culture" into his comic strips, such as the [[MMORPG]] ''World of <!-- READ THIS: Please DO NOT CHANGE THIS to âWarcraftâââWarquestâ is a fictional game from the comic strip, obviously a joke mixing Warcraft and Everquest. Thanks for your cooperation. -->Warquest.''<ref>{{cite web | author=Amend, Bill|date=[[2001-03-12]] | url=http://homepage.mac.com/brossow/wikipedia/foxtrot_aybabtu.gif | title=FoxTrot | format=GIF | accessdate=2006-05-15}}</ref>
â
*On [[March 21]] [[2001]], online parody news source ''[[The Onion]]'' jumped in to the fray with an article titled "Congress Adds 'All Your Base Are Belong To Us' Amendment To Bankruptcy Bill", written in a style that conformed to the original gaffe-fueled fad.<ref>http://www.theonion.com/content/node/31812</ref> Stating that the U.S. House of Representatives had voted to do so "Seeking to increase fiscal accountability among citizens who have no chance to survive make their time," in a measure disputed by opponents as "potentially set up U.S. the bomb."
+
*On [[March 21]] [[2001]], online parody news source ''[[The Onion]]'' jumped in to the fray with an article titled "Congress Adds 'All Your Base Are Belong To Us' Amendment To Bankruptcy Bill", written in a style that conformed to the original gaffe-fueled fad.<ref>{{cite web
  +
| url = http://www.theonion.com/content/node/31812
  +
| title = Congress Adds 'All Your Base Are Belong To Us' Amendment To Bankruptcy Bill
  +
| accessdate = 2006-12-13
  +
| date = [[2001-03-21]]
  +
| publisher = The Onion
  +
}}
  +
</ref> Stating that the U.S. House of Representatives had voted to do so "Seeking to increase fiscal accountability among citizens who have no chance to survive make their time," in a measure disputed by opponents as "potentially set up U.S. the bomb."
*On [[January 6]] [[2002]], an episode of the television show ''[[Futurama]]'' ("[[Anthology of Interest II]]," episode #403) featured a segment in which a robot from the arcade game [[Berzerk]] said, "All your base are belong to us."<ref>{{cite web | author=Morton, Lewis|date=[[2002-01-06]] | url=http://www.imsdb.com/transcripts/Futurama-Anthology-Of-Interest-II.html | title='Anthology Of Interest II' Transcript at IMSDb | work=Internet Movie Script Database | accessdate=2006-05-15}}</ref>
*On [[January 6]] [[2002]], an episode of the television show ''[[Futurama]]'' ("[[Anthology of Interest II]]," episode #403) featured a segment in which a robot from the arcade game [[Berzerk]] said, "All your base are belong to us."<ref>{{cite web | author=Morton, Lewis|date=[[2002-01-06]] | url=http://www.imsdb.com/transcripts/Futurama-Anthology-Of-Interest-II.html | title='Anthology Of Interest II' Transcript at IMSDb | work=Internet Movie Script Database | accessdate=2006-05-15}}</ref>
